result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew Brian Steves was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle T&R in defendants name, as is defendant himself.  IID to be installed within 14 days.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Defendant must be in full compliance with Drivers Safety Plan, IID order and DL revocation order as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: 14 days to be served with 31 days I&S as defendant is eligible for SSTOP program.  Jail with huber for work/treatment and/or EM if deft qualifies under jail classificaiton system.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Brian Steves

records.addlTxt: Driver Safety Plan Report
of Motion Hearing on 12-08-2015

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:01am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Ellison.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VR not applicable.

COURT accepts Amended Criminal Complaint
State moves to:
Ct. 2 (PAC 3rd)>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT has discussion with Atty Ellison regarding ethics of mental impression of client.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Attorney Ellison makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: $1694 inclusive (No DNA surcharge/sample); 45 days MCJ Total: 14 days to be served with 31 days I&S as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work/treatment, and/or EM, if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days; 24 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA (deemed already completed);  Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 12 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation.

Adj: 9:19am
and Certificate of Appearance (attempted service of subpoena on K.L.S. 12/8/15)
and Certificate of Appearance (attempted service of suboena on W.S.O. 12/8/15)

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:53pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears in person with Atty Keith Ellison
(Motion to Suppress)

State notes Motion is on stop, and Motion on Miranda issue>>
COURT questions Atty Ellison re: statements that are being sought for suppression - Atty Ellison makes statement.
State directs that there is only one statement is at issue - Atty Ellison makes arguments.
COURT directs that both counsel must watch video/audio before hearing can be held on that issue.

COURT addresses Motion to Suppress stop>>
Officer Cheng Yang (MCSD) sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
Argument by both counsel.
Court makes findings - COURT denies Motion to Suppress.

COURT addresses MIL>>
COURT grants #1 and #2

COURT recesses 3:38pm
BOTR: 4:17pm
State notes information that will and will not be used during trial from DVD; Argument by Atty Ellison.
COURT makes findings - statements in question may be used at trial.

Adj: 4:37pm
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoenas mailed to K.L.S. & W.S.O. 12/3/15)
w/letter - stj
Statements - stj
Sent to Judge
Motion hearing at 12-08-2015 02:45 pm
